6.46.text:
Hi I’m Ferg Neal, we’re going around and
interviewing some of the top comedians in

10.49.text:
the country, today we went down to the ABC
studios, which look, it wasn’t channel 9,

14.32.text:
but you make do with what you got. Today we
talked to triple J host and comedian,

23.82.text:
Matt how are you feeling today?
I’m good I’m good, I’m tired,

29.52.text:
I stayed up way too late last night I was writing a
song.

33.22.text:
Yeah coz I heard that you rap?
I do rap a bit I was laying down some sick beats,

41.02.text:
And you’ve won a few awards for just generally
talking about life.

44.81.text:
Yeah that’s exactly what I was doing.
So you won-

46.76.text:
I was just talking, I mean I was telling people
what I had for breakfast and I won some awards

54.99.text:
Like you won the comedy release of the ARIAs,
you also won the director’s choice of last

58.48.text:
year’s comedy festival, you’ve got a self
titled show at this year’s comedy festival,

64.22.text:
Well the thing is you know the self titled
stuff-

67.58.text:
That‘s like something what fucking Kanye West might
do-

70.30.text:
No I didn’t understand that, the thing is-
Most people have a name for their show-

74.87.text:
I know it’s like “close encounters of
the Okine” or something like that.

80.85.text:
They ask you to register for the comedy festival
like 6 months ago. And I was still doing my

85.39.text:
last show I didn’t know what I was gonna
talk about so I cant be saying, you know,

90.25.text:
Matt Okine’s Show: Love, Happiness and Banana
Crumpets and when it comes to the time of

97.77.text:
me actually doing the show there’s no talk
about banana crumpets there’s no talk about banana crumpets

101.64.text:
and then people are like “uugh”.
People from the Australian Banana Crumpet association

104.13.text:
are like you promised us crumpet
talk! And I didn’t have any crumpet jokes at that stage

108.91.text:
So it’s a comedians job to kinda cut through
the bullshit so we got some student dilmemas

113.75.text:
that have come up I thought I could read them
out and you can help solve them.

117.20.text:
So this happened in Sweden, so your Uber Driver
turns out to be a disgruntled taxi driver

122.45.text:
who tells you he’s driving you to the police
station.

124.72.text:
Oh!
Yeah this happened in Sweden.

127.54.text:
Really?
Yeah so an off duty taxi driver as an Uber

130.62.text:
driver, which is illegal in itself but we’ll
just ignore that.

133.51.text:
I reckon by the time he’s dropped you at
the police station and realizes that the fare

137.59.text:
is 20% less than what he’s normally charging
he’s gonna be like “actually stay in!

143.84.text:
The next situation is you’re at a party,
and this is a common problem for uni students

149.34.text:
coz uni students are very poor, someone steals
your goon sack at a party, do you have to hunt

152.84.text:
them down and retrieve it or do you have to
bide your time and know that sooner or later...

157.96.text:
It depends are they flaunting it around the
party?

161.06.text:
Yeah I guess they’re flaunting, they’re
showing off

164.72.text:
You should never show off bagged wine by the
way.

168.70.text: Especially if you're so pov that you didn’t even buy your own bagged wine

174.88.text: I mean you gotta use that shiny alfoil packaging and you need

179.15.text: to take a good hard look at yourself.

180.90.text:
I’ve got a friend who wore it as a hat before
and it wasn’t their goon sack to flaunt,

186.38.text:
they shouldn’t have used it as a fashion
apparel, what should you do in that situation?

191.04.text:
When I have bagged wine it's often much heavier
because I quite like taking the nozzle out.

198.72.text:
Yeah that’s a good technique thanks for
sharing.

201.15.text:
Pouring in a bottle of 1.25L Fanta that’s
how I always do it.

205.90.text: You try and dilute the shitness

207.00.text:
Well yeah exactly and you know it just makes
for a very swollen sack,

215.39.text: do you know what I mean so you gotta be hella careful, so I mean I wish whoever is stealing all the best

222.88.text:
but they better have hands like bloody Peter
Schmichael.

225.50.text: On radio you talk a lot about Ja Rule, why Ja Rule as opposed to

230.47.text: Coz it's Ja Rule man come on! I guess when I was in high school, Ja Rule was the man!

239.49.text: He dropped some serious jams, but then he kinda disappeared and I think the reason why I bring it up as

243.51.text:
well is because recently my girlfriend and
I were talking about that song mesmorised,

249.97.text:
and then you know we went out and had drinks
and dinner and then that night we were like,

258.21.text: In the bedroom, gonna keep it PG,

260.21.text: Yeah PG’s good but also elaborate

263.01.text:
We were getting intimate and then I thought,
like I just looked down at her and thought

268.05.text:
it would be a good time to do a Ja Rule impersonation
so I thought

281.23.text: Absolutely, literally she just goes "what did you just say?" And I went "I don’t know

287.45.text: I think I just did a Ja Rule impersonation" and she goes "why?"

291.34.text: I know a lot of comedians despise hecklers,

294.19.text:
Yeah look sometimes Hecklers can be really
good.

299.34.text: Yeah but 99% of the time they’re real shite.

301.29.text:
Yeah the real problem with hecklers is when
they just wanna have a conversation, you know?

308.11.text:
And you’ll be like “so I was at the shops
the other day” and someone’ll be like,

312.09.text:
‘Which one?’ And I’m like shut up it
doesn’t matter which one it could be any one

316.87.text:
Do you stop and address it? Or do you try
ignore it?

318.73.text:
Well if it keeps happening coz you’ll be
like “I dunno it was Coles or whatever’

322.48.text:
and they’ll be like “Coles in broadway?’
and I’ll be like what’s going on here?

327.88.text: Can you talk us through the hat? I saw a Facebook post you said something about you don’t

334.56.text: have the hat you can’t do the flap.

338.42.text:
We stupidly decided we wanted to bring something
back from the 90s okay?

343.15.text:
Oh me and Alex my radio co host, so we put
the call out to Australia and the most people

348.89.text:
replied you should bring the legionaires hat
back, and we were like sick lets do that but

353.26.text:
little did we know that that would require
us to wear legionaires hats at any given opportunity

357.81.text:
so now I’m wearing a legionaires hat with
my own name on it, what a dickhead, but I

364.55.text:
have to because if I don’t then people who see
this will be like “Oi Okine saw your fuckin

371.82.text:
interview you you weren’t wearing the legionaires
hat, letting the team down.

374.96.text:
Do you get people send abusive stuff to you?
Yeha all the time, like I would say It’s

382.24.text: a very rare day where someone doesn’t tell me that they think I’m shit, when you seen

386.01.text: in to Triple J on 0439757555, when you send in it comes into the big page where all the

394.85.text:
texts come in just in a line, and then you
can approve some that you want to read back

398.77.text:
later and then you can reject some which are
one’s that are like, “you suck” basically,

404.32.text:
just for fun while we were at good as Friday
we checked the rejected entries list, there’s

407.78.text:
a big long list of people saying “this is
shit” “this is the shittiest piece of shit ever”

412.81.text:
then I looked down the bottom
of one page and it said, “Matt Okine is

416.24.text:
a Mong” right? Now this was at 1:15pm in the
afternoon when I was reading them out, but

423.04.text:
that text got sent in at 9:59 that morning,
when I was not even on radio, I was just in

431.42.text:
bed doing nothing I wasn’t harming anyone
and all of a sudden, some wanker is like

439.09.text: “it’s time! Matt Okine is a Mong!”

442.44.text:
That probably draws us to a wrap, so your
show, self titled Matt Okine is happening now

448.06.text:
Yes, so come to Melbourne Town Hall and see
my show!
